intro: Genista splendens, commonly known as the golden broom, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in early spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rocky or coastal environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
